greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime of the form (n^k-1)/(n-1), or 0 if no such prime exists.
comment: As mentioned by Dubner, when n is a power (greater than 1) of a prime, then (n^k-1)/(n-1) will usually be composite for all k, which is the case for n = 9, 25, 32 and 49. - _T. D. Noe_, Jan 23 2004
link: H. Dubner, Generalized repunit primes, Math. Comp., 61 (1993), 927-930.
mathematica: Table[SelectFirst[(n^# - 1)/(n - 1) & /@ Range[10^3], PrimeQ] /. k_ /; MissingQ@ k -> 0, {n, 2, 34}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Apr 24 2017, Version 10.2 *)
xref: Cf. A084740 (least k such that (n^k-1)/(n-1) is prime).
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_ and Meenakshi Srikanth (menakan_s(AT)yahoo.com), Jun 15 2003
ext: More terms from _T. D. Noe_, Jan 23 2004
